text: David Rynin (October 15, 1905 - February 24, 2000) was an American philosopher. He is known mostly as an exponent of logical positivism. He served as president of the Pacific division of the American Philosophical Association in the years 1956–7. Until his death, he was professor emeritus at the University of California, Berkeley. ==References== *Presidential addresses of the American Philosophical Association, 1951-1960, pg. 374, Prometheus Books, 2006 ==See also== *American philosophy *List of American philosophers Category:American philosophers Category:Analytic philosophers Category:1905 births Category:2000 deaths Category:20th-century philosophers
title: David Rynin
